text: well much of America is tightening its
belt the high-end luxury sector is
recovering during the recession luxury
goods were hit hard but now sales are
gaining strength with some high-end
retailers even raising prices gilt
groupe is an online site that
specializes in designer brands at a
discount and executives there say items
priced more than ten thousand dollars
have been selling briskly so these are
some of the highest prices we've sold on
gilt and it's been a while since we've
sold those type of price points so I
think it indicates definitely a
bounce-back in the luxury sector
analysts say that much of this is
because the stock market is up nearly
double from its lows at the height of
the financial crisis the stock market is
a huge leading indicator of luxury
business and the stock market obviously
has been doing considerably better since
the recession and the affluent class who
were really paralyzed by the recession
are coming out of that paralysis and
doing it in a very important way
although revenue hasn't reached
pre-recession levels it is up at
companies like Tiffany's and LVMH which
owns louisvuitton meanwhile regular
apparel stores are struggling to get
customers to spend at all the word
really is bifurcation and the luxury
class of people who are enjoying gains
from the stock market and more security
in their professional careers are really
fueling this luxury explosion and the
commensurate reaction at the lower
levels is a little bit less enthusiastic
or less ebulan still the top twenty
percent of earners in the u.s. account
for nearly sixty percent of all spending
according to Moody's and it is this
demographic that luxury retailers are
courting I think the majority of our
customer is more aspirational but we
certainly have a small percentage of our
customer contributes to a fair amount of
our revenue that can afford to buy those
products consistently the difference
between people on a budget and luxury
spenders is huge Neiman Marcus recently
sold out of a 770
$5.00 Christian Louboutin heel in just
weeks for that same amount shoppers
could buy 129 pairs of Walmart ballet
